refnamediv.refpurpose: ELF analyzer to identify missing static modifiers

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: missingstatic is a script that analyses ELF object files to identify symbols that are unused outside their compilation unit. Those symbols are usually candidate for the static modifier, to make the symbol local to the unit.

In addition to symbols that are used only internally to an unit, this script will most likely report the almost entire set of externally-visible API in the case of libraries. For this reason, options are provided to reduce the scope of action.

listitem.para: Only show symbols that have hidden visibility. Hidden symbols are not visible from outside the module, and thus will ignore the external visible symbols that compose the externally-visible API. This option is only useful for libraries that make proper use of visibility attributes.

Show the type of the symbol. The symbols reported by the script might be functions, variables, or constants. By default, only the name of the symbol, with this option, a letter in front of the symbol will tell you the type of it; the letters are the same as used by GNU nm:
T
The symbol is in the text (code) section, and is thus a function
B
The symbol is in the uninitialised data section (known as BSS), and is thus a variable.
D
The symbol is in the initialised data section, and is thus a variable.
D
The symbol is in the read only data section, and is thus a constant.
Ignore symbols whose name triggers the given regular expression. This option is useful to hide all the symbols of the public API of a library if they all have the same prefix.
Read the list of files to analyse from the given file (or standard input if path is -) rather than from the command line. Useful to pass a long list of files, that is generated asynchronously.
